subject: Fashion
title: Male Body Image in Fashion
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Male Body Image in Fashion.

hook.text: Action figures in the 1970s had average bodies. Today's versions have biceps no real human can grow.

buildup.text: Men's fashion increasingly features ultra-lean, muscular modelsâ€”a standard fueling gym obsession and steroids.

discovery.text: Male eating disorders rose 70% in a decade, yet they receive a fraction of the research funding.

twist.text: Society rarely frames this as a fashion problem. But the images men see in ads shape self-worth too.

climax.text: Body image isn't a women's issue. Fashion's impossible standards damage everyone regardless of gender.

punchline.text: Men struggle too. Fashion's lens distorts every body.
